title: Stanbic Bank Supports Nneka Foundation
text:
2 September 2015 17:44 CET Stanbic Bank Supports Nneka Foundation By Daily Guide 
Stanbic Bank Ghana Ltd has presented a cheque for GH¢10,000, exercise books and other souvenirs to Nneka Youth Foundation (NYF), a Non-profit organization operating in the Volta region. 
The donation, which forms part of the bank's annual corporate social responsibility programme, is to support the annual Summer Youth Camp organized by the foundation for Junior High School (JHS) students in deprived communities such as Kpando, Hohoe, Afadjato South, North and South Dayi. 
About 3,000 teenagers are participating in this year's camp dubbed, 'World Changers Camp 2015' currently ongoing at Ve-Agbome in the Afadjato South district. 
The annual camp, which is in its fourth year, is aimed at empowering and equipping the young teenagers with values to enable them overcome challenges in the rural areas. 
Linda Aryee, Corporate Communications Executive of Stanbic Bank, told BUSINESS GUIDE that the gesture is part of Stanbic Bank's contribution to improving the lives of young people to drive societal change and development. 
'As a bank which believes in moving forward, it's just appropriate to involve the young ones who are the future of this country by supporting and encouraging them to be the best they can be,' she stated. 
She assured the Foundation of the bank's continuous support in future programmes, noting that 'we’ve been with Nneka from the onset in 2012 and the bond between us can only grow stronger going into future.' 
The founder of Nneka Youth Foundation, Cecilia Fiaka, expressed gratitude to Stanbic Bank and other benevolent companies for supporting her vision of changing the lives of rural teenagers and called on other benevolent entities to fight social vices, which are affecting the holistic development of young rural dwellers. 
'We appreciate Stanbic's continuous contribution in helping us to equip these underprivileged young ones to combat life-threatening issues confronting them and we are appealing to other entities to collaborate with us in this regard.' 
The Stanbic bank's delegation, which included Patrick Asiamah, Human Resource, also interacted with the youngsters at the camp and encouraged them to attain greater heights.
